name: cfimage
description:
Creates a ColdFusion image that can be manipulated by using image functions.
You can use the cfimage tag to perform common image manipulation operations as a shortcut to Image functions.
You can use the cfimage tag independently or in conjunction with image functions.

params.name: angle
params.description: Angle in degrees to rotate the image.

params.name: color
params.description:
(border) Border color.
Hexadecimal value or supported named color.
For a hexadecimal value, use the form "##xxxxxx" or "xxxxxx". (required)

params.name: destination
params.description:
Absolute or relative pathname where the image output is written.
The image format is determined by the file extension.
The convert and write actions require a destination.
The border, captcha, resize, and rotate actions require either a name attribute or a destination attribute.
You can specify both.
Scorpio supports only CAPTCHA images in PNG format.
If you do not enter a destination, the CAPTCHA image is placed inline in the HTML output and displayed in the web browser.

params.name: difficulty
params.description: Level of complexity of the CAPTCHA text.

params.name: fontSize
params.description:
Font size of the text in the CAPTCHA image.
The value must be an integer.

params.name: format
params.description:
Format of the image displayed in the browser.
If you do not specify a format, the image is displayed in PNG format.
You cannot display a GIF image in a browser.
GIF images are displayed in PNG format.

params.name: height
params.description:
Height in pixels of the image.
For the resize attribute, you also can specify the height as a percentage (an integer followed by the "%" symbol).
The value must be an integer.

params.name: isBase64
params.description: Specifies whether the source is a Base64 string or not.

params.name: name
params.description:
Name of the ColdFusion image variable to create.
The read action requires name attribute.
The border, resize, and rotate options require a name attribute or a destination attribute.
You can specify both.

params.name: overwrite
params.description:
Valid only if the destination attribute is specified.
If the destination file already exists, ColdFusion generates an error if the overwrite option is not set to yes.

params.name: quality
params.description:
Quality of the JPEG destination file.
Applies only to files with an extension of JPG or JPEG.
Valid values are fractions that range from 0 through 1
(the lower the number, the lower the quality).

params.name: source
params.description:
URL of the source image; for example, "http://www.google.com/ images/logo.gif"
Absolute or relative pathname of the source image; for example, "c:\wwwroot\images\logo.jpg"
ColdFusion image variable containing another image, BLOB, or byte array; for example, "#myImage#" 
Base64 string; for example, "data:image/jpg;base64,/9j/ 4AAQSkZJRgABAQA.............."

params.name: structName
params.description: Name of the ColdFusion structure to be created.

params.name: text
params.description:
Text string displayed in the CAPTCHA image.
Use capital letters for better readability.

params.name: thickness
params.description:
Border thickness in pixels.
The border is added to the outside edge of the source image,
increasing the image area accordingly.
The value must be an integer.

params.name: width
params.description:
Width in pixels of the image.
For resize, you also can specify the width as a percentage
(an integer followed by the "%" symbol).
The value must be an integer.

params.name: fonts
params.description: One or more valid fonts to use for the CAPTCHA text. Separate multiple fonts with commas. ColdFusion supports only the system fonts that the JDK can recognize.

params.name: interpolation
params.description: CF10+ Used when action=resize determines the interpolation algorithm to use.

links.title: CFML Image Functions Listing
links.description: List of image manipulation functions in CFML. Most of what you can do with the cfimage tag can also be done with image functions.

examples.title: Border action
examples.description: Add a red border of 5 pixels to an image, write the output to a variable.

examples.title: Captcha action
examples.description: Generate a CAPTCHA style image using medium difficulty.
examples.code: <cfimage action="captcha" text="Captcha!" difficulty="medium" fontSize="18" fonts="Comic Sans MS,Times New Roman">

examples.title: Convert action
examples.description: Convert an image to a different format (in this case PNG).

examples.title: Info action
examples.description: Retrieve meta data from an image and stores that as a structure in a variable.

examples.title: Read action
examples.description: Tag syntax for reading an image from a URL.

examples.title: Resize action
examples.description: Example of resizing an image stored in a variable and storing the result in a variable.

examples.title: Rotate action
examples.code: <cfimage action="rotate" source="#sourceImage#" destination="#expandPath( 'rotated.jpg' )#" overwrite="true" angle="30" quality="1">

examples.title: Write action
examples.description: Example of writing an image as an 80% compressed jpg image.

examples.title: WriteToBrowser action
examples.description: Generates HTML to output the image in place.
